author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 17-year-old student was arrested on charges of assault and attempt to murder after he attacked another student with a penknife following a quarrel in the classroom near Tiruthangal on Friday.

Police said that the accused boy, studying Plus One at Government Higher Secondary School in Poovanathapuram, complained that one of his books was missing when he came to the classroom in the morning.

When he asked one of his classmates whether he took it, he replied that he did not.

This led to a quarrel between them, and the accused boy slashed the other boy’s hip with the penknife. While the injured was admitted to Sivakasi Government Hospital, the accused was arrested by Tiruthangal police.
title: Boy held for attacking classmate with penknife
